citations.narrative:
***Facility records indicate a red kangaroo was sold on August 10, 2023 but there are no corresponding records to show
where the kangaroo came from, whether purchased, born on property, etc. The facility shall make and maintain records
that disclose complete information on all animals acquired as well as there final dispositions.
Correct by March 30, 2024.

***On the morning of March 13, 2024 just prior to USDA arrival for inspection, the facility found a young goat dead at the
food trough. It appeared the goat had put her head through the fence wire and become entangled between the trough and
the fence. The feed trough is attached to the fence loosely with wrapped wire leaving gaps 3 or more inches wide. The
troughs, if continued to be used, shall be attached in a manner that will remove the gaps and secure them eliminating the
risk to the goats and sheep, or another means of feeding them provided to protect the them from injury or death.
Correct by March 15, 2024

***A contingency plan has not been developed for the facility. The facility must develop, document, and follow an
appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the
event of an emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good
health and well-being of the animals in their possession).
Correct by March 30, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner.
